title: Psycho-Physiological Measures for Assessing Cognitive Load
authors: Eija Haapalainen, SeungJun Kim, Jodi F. Forlizzi, Anind K. Dey
conference: ACM International Conference on Ubiquitous Computing
hypotheses: Multi-sensor fusion can achieve real-time cognitive load detection with >80% accuracy for ubicomp applications
notes: Foundational work establishing feasibility of real-time cognitive load assessment using physiological measures. Compared multiple sensors and found ECG median absolute deviation and heat flux most effective when combined.
strengths: Rigorous empirical validation, practical applicability, multi-sensor comparison, real-time feasibility
weaknesses: Limited to physiological measures, small sample size, specific task domains
citation: Haapalainen, E., Kim, S., Forlizzi, J.F., & Dey, A.K. (2010). Psycho-physiological measures for assessing cognitive load. UbiComp 2010.

title: Physiological time-series analysis using approximate entropy and sample entropy
authors: Joshua S. Richman, J. Randall Moorman
journal: American Journal of Physiology-Heart and Circulatory Physiology
hypotheses: Sample entropy provides more consistent complexity measurement than approximate entropy for cardiovascular time series
notes: Critical methodological paper establishing Sample Entropy (SampEn) as improvement over Approximate Entropy. Fundamental for all subsequent entropy-based behavioral analysis.
strengths: Mathematical rigor, extensive validation, theoretical foundation, wide applicability
weaknesses: Focus on cardiovascular data, limited behavioral applications discussed
citation: Richman, J.S., & Moorman, J.R. (2000). Physiological time-series analysis using approximate entropy and sample entropy. American Journal of Physiology-Heart and Circulatory Physiology, 278(6), H2039-H2049.

title: Analyzing spatial data from mouse tracker methodology: An entropic approach
authors: Simone Sulpizio et al.
hypotheses: Entropy-based analysis of mouse trajectories reveals cognitive processes not captured by traditional geometric measures
notes: First systematic application of entropy measures to mouse tracking data. Introduces EMOT framework combining movement and pause analysis.
strengths: Novel methodology, cognitive process discrimination, practical implementation
weaknesses: Limited validation tasks, parameter sensitivity, computational complexity
citation: Sulpizio, S., et al. (2017). Analyzing spatial data from mouse tracker methodology: An entropic approach. Behavior Research Methods, 49(6), 2012-2030.

title: EEG-Based Prediction of Cognitive Load in Intelligence Tests
authors: Nir Friedman, Tomer Fekete, Kobi Gal, Oren Shriki
hypotheses: EEG frequency band patterns can predict cognitive load during intelligence test performance
notes: Demonstrates real-time cognitive load prediction using EEG during complex cognitive tasks. Important for understanding neural correlates of behavioral entropy patterns.
strengths: Real-time prediction, complex cognitive tasks, neural validation
weaknesses: Intrusive measurement, limited to laboratory settings, individual differences
citation: Friedman, N., Fekete, T., Gal, K., & Shriki, O. (2019). EEG-based prediction of cognitive load in intelligence tests. Frontiers in Human Neuroscience, 13, 191.

title: A Survey on Measuring Cognitive Workload in Human-Computer Interaction
authors: Thomas Kosch, Jakob Karolus, Johannes Zagermann, Harald Reiterer, Albrecht Schmidt, Paweł W. Woźniak
hypotheses: Behavioral measures show promise for cognitive workload assessment but require sophisticated processing
notes: Comprehensive survey of cognitive workload measurement in HCI. Critical for understanding state-of-the-art and identifying gaps in behavioral measurement approaches.
strengths: Comprehensive coverage, methodological analysis, HCI focus, practical recommendations
weaknesses: Limited novel contributions, survey format, broad scope
citation: Kosch, T., Karolus, J., Zagermann, J., Reiterer, H., Schmidt, A., & Woźniak, P.W. (2023). A survey on measuring cognitive workload in human-computer interaction. ACM Computing Surveys.

title: Approximate Entropy and Sample Entropy: A Comprehensive Tutorial
authors: Alfonso Delgado-Bonal, Alexander Marshak
hypotheses: Sample entropy provides more reliable complexity measures than approximate entropy across diverse applications
notes: Essential methodological reference for entropy-based time series analysis. Provides practical guidelines and comparative analysis of entropy measures.
strengths: Comprehensive tutorial, practical guidelines, extensive examples, methodological rigor
weaknesses: Limited novel theoretical contributions, tutorial format
citation: Delgado-Bonal, A., & Marshak, A. (2019). Approximate entropy and sample entropy: A comprehensive tutorial. Entropy, 21(6), 541.

title: The Appropriate Use of Approximate Entropy and Sample Entropy with Short Data Sets
authors: Jenna M. Yentes, Nathaniel Hunt, Kendra K. Schmid, Jeffrey P. Kaipust, Denise McGrath, Nikolaos Stergiou
hypotheses: Parameter selection critically affects entropy measure reliability with short behavioral time series
notes: Critical for HCI applications where real-time entropy calculation requires short data windows. Provides guidelines for reliable entropy estimation.
strengths: Practical relevance, parameter guidelines, short data focus, validation study
weaknesses: Limited to biomechanics applications, narrow scope
citation: Yentes, J.M., Hunt, N., Schmid, K.K., Kaipust, J.P., McGrath, D., & Stergiou, N. (2013). The appropriate use of approximate entropy and sample entropy with short data sets. Annals of Biomedical Engineering, 41(2), 349-365.

title: Mouse Dynamics Behavioral Biometrics: A Survey
authors: Simon Khan, Daqing Hou
hypotheses: Mouse behavioral patterns exhibit user-specific signatures suitable for biometric identification and cognitive state estimation
notes: Comprehensive survey of mouse dynamics research with implications for entropy-based behavioral analysis. Identifies feature extraction and classification approaches.
strengths: Comprehensive coverage, behavioral focus, practical applications, extensive bibliography
weaknesses: Limited entropy measure discussion, survey format, biometric focus
citation: Khan, S., & Hou, D. (2022). Mouse dynamics behavioral biometrics: A survey. ACM Computing Surveys.

title: Keystroke Dynamics Patterns While Writing Positive and Negative Texts
authors: Agnieszka Landowska
hypotheses: Emotional state affects temporal entropy patterns in keystroke dynamics
notes: Demonstrates connection between affective state and behavioral entropy in typing patterns. Relevant for understanding cognitive-emotional influences on interaction entropy.
strengths: Affective computing relevance, behavioral focus, statistical rigor
weaknesses: Limited entropy analysis, narrow task domain, small effect sizes
citation: Landowska, A. (2021). Keystroke dynamics patterns while writing positive and negative texts. Sensors, 21(17), 5963.

title: An initial user model design for adaptive interface development in learning management system based on cognitive load
authors: Kautsarina
hypotheses: Real-time cognitive load adaptation improves learning outcomes in educational interfaces
notes: Practical application of cognitive load measurement for adaptive interface design. Demonstrates feasibility of real-time adaptation based on cognitive indicators.
strengths: Practical application, educational domain, adaptive system design, user modeling
weaknesses: Limited entropy focus, narrow domain, preliminary results
citation: Kautsarina. (2024). An initial user model design for adaptive interface development in learning management system based on cognitive load. Cognition, Technology & Work, 26(4), 653-672.

title: Benchmarking Transfer Entropy Methods for the Study of Linear and Nonlinear Cardio-Respiratory Interactions
authors: Andrea Rozo, John Morales, Jonathan Moeyersons, Rohan Joshi, Enrico G. Caiani, Pascal Borzée, Bertien Buyse, Dries Testelmans, Sabine Van Huffel, Carolina Varon
hypotheses: Transfer entropy reveals directional causal relationships between physiological and behavioral modalities
notes: Important methodological work on transfer entropy with implications for multi-modal behavioral analysis in HCI contexts.
strengths: Methodological rigor, causal analysis, multi-modal focus, benchmarking approach
weaknesses: Limited to physiological signals, complex methodology, computational requirements
citation: Rozo, A., Morales, J., Moeyersons, J., et al. (2021). Benchmarking transfer entropy methods for the study of linear and nonlinear cardio-respiratory interactions. Entropy, 23(8), 939.

title: Cognitive state detection with eye tracking in the field: an experience sampling study and its lessons learned
authors: Moritz Langner, Peyman Toreini, Alexander Maedche
hypotheses: Eye tracking patterns can detect cognitive states in real-world field conditions
notes: Field study demonstrating practical challenges and opportunities for real-world cognitive state detection using behavioral measures.
strengths: Field study, real-world conditions, practical insights, longitudinal design
weaknesses: Limited entropy analysis, eye tracking focus, small sample size
citation: Langner, M., Toreini, P., & Maedche, A. (2024). Cognitive state detection with eye tracking in the field: an experience sampling study and its lessons learned. i-com, 23(1), 61-75.

title: Cognitive Load Inference Using Physiological Markers in Virtual Reality
authors: Jishang Wei, Erika Siegel, Prahalathan Sundaramoorthy, Antonio Gomes, Shibo Zhang, Mithra Vankipuram, Kevin Smathers, Sarthak Ghosh, Hiroshi Horii, Jeremy Bailenson, Rafael Ballagas
hypotheses: Multi-modal physiological markers can predict cognitive load in VR environments with high accuracy
notes: Large-scale study (N=738) demonstrating practical cognitive load prediction in immersive environments. Relevant for understanding entropy patterns in complex interaction contexts.
strengths: Large sample size, VR context, multi-modal approach, machine learning validation
weaknesses: Limited behavioral measures, VR-specific context, proprietary dataset
citation: Wei, J., Siegel, E., Sundaramoorthy, P., et al. (2024). Cognitive load inference using physiological markers in virtual reality. Stanford VR Lab Technical Report.

title: Theory-based approach for assessing cognitive load during time-critical resource-managing human–computer interactions: an eye-tracking study
authors: Natalia Sevcenko, Tobias Appel, Manuel Ninaus, Korbinian Moeller, Peter Gerjets
hypotheses: Eye movement entropy patterns predict cognitive load during time-critical resource management tasks
notes: Theory-driven approach using eye tracking entropy measures for cognitive load assessment. Directly relevant to behavioral entropy analysis in HCI.
strengths: Theory-driven, entropy focus, time-critical tasks, practical relevance
weaknesses: Limited to eye tracking, specific task domain, small sample size
citation: Sevcenko, N., Appel, T., Ninaus, M., Moeller, K., & Gerjets, P. (2023). Theory-based approach for assessing cognitive load during time-critical resource-managing human–computer interactions: an eye-tracking study. Journal on Multimodal User Interfaces, 17(1), 1-19.

title: Cognitive Load Estimation with Behavioral Cues in Human-Machine Interaction
authors: Goeum Cha
hypotheses: Eye blinking and mouse tracking behavioral cues can estimate cognitive workload non-intrusively
notes: Thesis exploring non-intrusive behavioral measures for cognitive load estimation. Relevant for understanding entropy patterns in basic interaction behaviors.
strengths: Non-intrusive focus, behavioral measures, practical approach
weaknesses: Limited validation, thesis format, narrow behavioral scope
citation: Cha, G. (2020). Cognitive load estimation with behavioral cues in human-machine interaction. PhD Thesis, Purdue University.

title: Cognitive workload estimation using physiological measures: a review
authors: Debashis Das Chakladar, Partha Pratim Roy
hypotheses: Physiological measures provide reliable indicators of cognitive workload across different task domains
notes: Comprehensive review of physiological approaches to cognitive workload measurement. Important for understanding the relationship between physiological and behavioral entropy measures.
strengths: Comprehensive review, physiological focus, multi-domain analysis
weaknesses: Limited behavioral measures, review format, physiological bias
citation: Chakladar, D.D., & Roy, P.P. (2023). Cognitive workload estimation using physiological measures: a review. Cognitive Neurodynamics, 18(4), 1445-1465.

title: AdaptUI: A Framework for the development of Adaptive User Interfaces in Smart Product-Service Systems
authors: Gorka Unamuno et al.
hypotheses: Context-aware recommendation systems can drive effective adaptive user interface development
notes: Practical framework for adaptive interface development. Relevant for understanding how entropy-based user modeling can drive interface adaptation.
strengths: Practical framework, adaptive systems focus, real-world application
weaknesses: Limited entropy measures, framework focus, narrow domain
citation: Unamuno, G., et al. (2024). AdaptUI: A framework for the development of adaptive user interfaces in smart product-service systems. User Modeling and User-Adapted Interaction, 34(4), 1929-1980.

title: Machine learning-based cognitive load prediction model for AR-HUD to improve OSH of professional drivers
authors: Jian Teng, Fucheng Wan, Yiquan Kong, Ju-Kyoung Kim
hypotheses: Machine learning models can predict cognitive load for AR-HUD interface optimization
notes: Applied research demonstrating cognitive load prediction for adaptive interface design in safety-critical contexts.
strengths: Applied context, safety relevance, machine learning approach, interface optimization
weaknesses: Narrow application domain, limited behavioral measures, specialized context
citation: Teng, J., Wan, F., Kong, Y., & Kim, J.K. (2023). Machine learning-based cognitive load prediction model for AR-HUD to improve OSH of professional drivers. Frontiers in Public Health, 11, 1195961.

title: Enhancing User Engagement through Adaptive Interfaces: A Study on Real-time Personalization in Web Applications
authors: Zuen Cen, Yuxin Zhao
journal: Journal of Engineering and Technology: Business Management
hypotheses: Real-time personalization through adaptive interfaces significantly improves user engagement metrics
notes: Empirical study demonstrating effectiveness of adaptive interfaces for user engagement. Relevant for understanding practical applications of entropy-based adaptation.
strengths: Real-time adaptation, user engagement focus, empirical validation
weaknesses: Limited technical detail, narrow application domain, commercial focus
citation: Cen, Z., & Zhao, Y. (2024). Enhancing user engagement through adaptive interfaces: A study on real-time personalization in web applications. Journal of Engineering and Technology: Business Management, 1(6), 1-15.

title: User Modeling in Adaptive Interfaces
authors: Pat Langley
hypotheses: Machine learning can improve user interface adaptation through automated user modeling
notes: Foundational work on adaptive user interfaces and automated user modeling. Historical perspective on the development of adaptive system concepts.
strengths: Foundational importance, theoretical framework, early vision
weaknesses: Historical perspective, limited validation, pre-entropy era
citation: Langley, P. (1999). User modeling in adaptive interfaces. Proceedings of the Seventh International Conference on User Modeling.

title: A Human-Adaptive Model for User Performance and Fatigue Assessment Using Eye-Gaze Data
authors: Mindaugas Vasiljevas, Robertas Damaševičius, Rytis Maskeliūnas
hypotheses: Eye-gaze patterns can predict user performance and fatigue through damped harmonic oscillator modeling
notes: Novel theoretical model for user performance assessment using physiological signals. Relevant for understanding entropy patterns in performance dynamics.
strengths: Theoretical modeling, performance focus, physiological validation, adaptive framework
weaknesses: Limited to eye-gaze, theoretical emphasis, small validation study
citation: Vasiljevas, M., Damaševičius, R., & Maskeliūnas, R. (2023). A human-adaptive model for user performance and fatigue assessment using eye-gaze data. Electronics, 12(5), 1130.

title: Evaluation of Systems' Irregularity and Complexity: Sample Entropy, Its Derivatives, and Their Applications across Scales and Disciplines
authors: Anne Humeau-Heurtier
hypotheses: Sample entropy and its derivatives provide reliable complexity measures across diverse scales and disciplines
notes: Comprehensive overview of sample entropy applications across disciplines. Essential for understanding entropy measure selection and applications.
strengths: Comprehensive coverage, multidisciplinary perspective, methodological focus
weaknesses: Review format, limited novel contributions, broad scope
citation: Humeau-Heurtier, A. (2018). Evaluation of systems' irregularity and complexity: Sample entropy, its derivatives, and their applications across scales and disciplines. Entropy, 20(10), 794.

title: Comparison of entropy rate measures for the evaluation of time series complexity: simulations and application to heart rate and respiratory variability
authors: Chiara Bara, Riccardo Pernice, Cristina Angela Catania, Mirvana Hilal, Alberto Porta, Anne Humeau-Heurtier, Luca Faes
hypotheses: Different entropy rate measures show varying sensitivity to different types of time series complexity
notes: Methodological comparison of entropy measures for time series complexity assessment. Important for selecting appropriate entropy measures for behavioral data.
strengths: Methodological rigor, comparative analysis, practical guidelines, validation study
weaknesses: Limited to physiological data, methodological focus, narrow application scope
citation: Bara, C., Pernice, R., Catania, C.A., Hilal, M., Porta, A., Humeau-Heurtier, A., & Faes, L. (2024). Comparison of entropy rate measures for the evaluation of time series complexity: simulations and application to heart rate and respiratory variability. Biocybernetics and Biomedical Engineering, 44(2), 380-392.

title: On the use of approximate entropy and sample entropy with centre of pressure time-series
authors: Luis Montesinos, Rossana Castaldo, Leandro Pecchia
hypotheses: Entropy measures can effectively characterize postural control patterns in biomechanical time series
notes: Application of entropy measures to biomechanical data with relevance to motor control and behavioral pattern analysis.
strengths: Biomechanical application, entropy focus, practical validation
weaknesses: Limited to postural data, narrow scope, specialized application
citation: Montesinos, L., Castaldo, R., & Pecchia, L. (2018). On the use of approximate entropy and sample entropy with centre of pressure time-series. Journal of NeuroEngineering and Rehabilitation, 15(1), 116.

title: Analyzing entropy features in time-series data for pattern recognition in neurological conditions
authors: Andreu-Perez J., Poon C.C., Merrifield R.D., Wong S.T., Yang G.-Z.
hypotheses: Entropy features in neural time-series data can effectively support pattern recognition for neurological condition diagnosis
notes: Application of entropy measures to neural time-series for medical diagnosis. Relevant for understanding entropy patterns in cognitive conditions affecting HCI.
strengths: Medical application, neural data focus, pattern recognition approach, clinical relevance
weaknesses: Medical focus, limited HCI relevance, specialized domain
citation: Andreu-Perez, J., Poon, C.C., Merrifield, R.D., Wong, S.T., & Yang, G.-Z. (2024). Analyzing entropy features in time-series data for pattern recognition in neurological conditions. Artificial Intelligence in Medicine, 150, 102830.

title: A Novel Multivariate Sample Entropy Algorithm for Modeling Time Series Synchronization
authors: Mosabber Uddin Ahmed, Danilo P. Mandic
hypotheses: Multivariate sample entropy can capture synchronization patterns in multi-channel time series data
notes: Extension of sample entropy to multivariate contexts. Highly relevant for multi-modal behavioral analysis in HCI applications.
strengths: Multivariate approach, synchronization focus, methodological contribution, theoretical foundation
weaknesses: Mathematical complexity, limited validation, computational requirements
citation: Ahmed, M.U., & Mandic, D.P. (2018). A novel multivariate sample entropy algorithm for modeling time series synchronization. Entropy, 20(2), 82.

title: User Authentication Method Based on Keystroke Dynamics and Mouse Dynamics with Scene-Irrelated Features in Hybrid Scenes
authors: Xiujuan Wang, Yutong Shi
hypotheses: Combination of keystroke and mouse dynamics provides robust user authentication across different interaction contexts
notes: Multi-modal behavioral biometric approach. Relevant for understanding individual differences in behavioral entropy patterns across interaction modalities.
strengths: Multi-modal approach, practical application, scene independence, authentication focus
weaknesses: Biometric focus, limited entropy analysis, narrow application scope
citation: Wang, X., & Shi, Y. (2022). User authentication method based on keystroke dynamics and mouse dynamics with scene-irrelated features in hybrid scenes. Sensors, 22(17), 6627.

title: Mouse tracking performance: A new approach to analyzing continuous mouse tracking data
authors: Tim Meyer, Arnold D. Kim, Michael Spivey
hypotheses: Novel analysis approaches can better capture the continuous dynamics of mouse tracking data
notes: Methodological contribution to mouse tracking analysis. Relevant for understanding how to analyze continuous behavioral entropy patterns in mouse data.
strengths: Methodological innovation, continuous dynamics focus, practical validation
weaknesses: Limited entropy focus, narrow scope, methodological emphasis
citation: Meyer, T., Kim, A.D., & Spivey, M. (2023). Mouse tracking performance: A new approach to analyzing continuous mouse tracking data. Behavior Research Methods, 56(5), 4682-4694.

title: Combining Keystroke and Mouse Dynamics for Continuous User Authentication and Identification
authors: Soumik Mondal, Patrick Bours
hypotheses: Fusion of keystroke and mouse dynamics improves continuous user authentication accuracy
notes: Early work on multi-modal behavioral biometrics. Provides foundation for understanding individual differences in behavioral entropy patterns.
strengths: Multi-modal fusion, continuous authentication, practical approach
weaknesses: Limited validation, older methodology, authentication focus only
citation: Mondal, S., & Bours, P. (2016). Combining keystroke and mouse dynamics for continuous user authentication and identification. Conference paper.

title: Keystroke Dynamics: Concepts, Techniques, and Applications
authors: Faraz Hussain et al.
hypotheses: Keystroke dynamics provides reliable behavioral biometric identification across diverse applications and contexts
notes: Comprehensive recent survey of keystroke dynamics research. Important for understanding state-of-the-art in behavioral pattern analysis for typing behavior.
strengths: Comprehensive coverage, recent publication, practical applications, extensive bibliography
weaknesses: Survey format, limited entropy focus, biometric emphasis
citation: Hussain, F., et al. (2025). Keystroke dynamics: Concepts, techniques, and applications. ACM Computing Surveys.

title: Multi-modal decision fusion for continuous authentication
authors: Carlos A. Catania, Lex Fridman
hypotheses: Multi-modal fusion of behavioral biometrics improves continuous authentication reliability over single-modality approaches
notes: Early comprehensive work on multi-modal behavioral biometrics. Foundational for understanding how to integrate multiple behavioral entropy measures.
strengths: Multi-modal fusion, continuous authentication, comprehensive approach
weaknesses: Limited entropy analysis, older methodology, authentication focus
citation: Catania, C.A., & Fridman, L. (2015). Multi-modal decision fusion for continuous authentication. Computers & Electrical Engineering, 41, 142-156.
